SENT.plain: The triad of thiamine-responsive anaemia, diabetes mellitus and deafness has been reported in 15 patients with macrocytic anaemia, sometimes associated with moderate thrombocytopenia
The bone marrow aspirate usually shows megaloblastic changes and ringed sideroblasts
However, tri-lineage myelodysplasia has never been reported
We describe two patients who presented with diabetes, deafness and thiamine-responsive pancytopenia
Bone marrow aspirate and biopsy were typical of tri-lineage myelodysplasia
These findings suggest that thiamine may have a role in the regulation of haemopoiesis at the stem cell level
We propose the term 'thiamine-responsive myelodysplasia' rather than that of thiamine-responsive anaemia
